To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

nodes.body: Is there a reason why you don't use `AdicCompletion.lift` here?

```suggestion
We show that if `I ≤ J` and `I` is fg,
then `M` is `J`-adic complete implies `M` is `I`-adic complete.
```
Did you forget to change this or do you disagree?
Dot notation wouldn't work without this because goals of type `IsAdicCauchy I f` will have their implicit arguments automatically introduced.
Could you please move these up in the `AdicCauchySequence` section / namespace?

And could you please also add a `simp` lemma `AdicCauchySequence.mk_of (x : M) : AdicCauchySequence.mk (.of x) = .of x := sorry`? Possibly it is already proven by `simp`, then I think it is still useful for rewriting.
Maybe move these after `end AdicCompletion` to get rid of the ugly `_root_`?

```suggestion
lemma IsAdicComplete.mono_of_FG (hI : I.FG) [IsAdicComplete J M] : IsAdicComplete I M := by
```

```suggestion
lemma AdicCompletion.homOfLE_injective_of_FG_of_isAdicComplete (hI : I.FG) [IsAdicComplete J M] :
```
maybe, or is it too long?
Could you please add a comment here explaining the strategy? Maybe assuming `I^i` is generated by one element would keep it instructional and still quick to explain?

pullRequest.title: feat(RingTheory/AdicCompletion): monotonicity of adic-completeness
